de.samdev.absgdx.framework.entities.colliosiondetection

Interface CollisionGeometryOwner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnimationTile, AutoTile, EmptyTile, Entity, OuterMapCollisionOwner, PhysicsEntity, SimpleEntity, StaticTile, Tile

    public interface CollisionGeometryOwner
    An Object that contains 0-to-many collisionGeometries (e.g. Entity)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canCollideWith(CollisionGeometryOwner other)
      Get if this object can collide with an other return FALSE: This Entity has no collisions - not even collision notices return TRUE : This Entity can either hard or soft collide - depending on canMoveCollide() [!] ATTENTION PLS: The results of this function should be commutative ( a.canCollideWith(b) == b.canCollideWith(a) ).
      boolean canMoveCollideWith(CollisionGeometryOwner other)
      Get if this object can not move into another.

    • Method Detail

      • canCollideWith

        boolean canCollideWith(CollisionGeometryOwner other)
        Get if this object can collide with an other return FALSE: This Entity has no collisions - not even collision notices return TRUE : This Entity can either hard or soft collide - depending on canMoveCollide() [!] ATTENTION PLS: The results of this function should be commutative ( a.canCollideWith(b) == b.canCollideWith(a) ). If they are not canCollide(a, b) is calculated as a.canCollideWith(b) OR b.canCollideWith(a)
        Parameters:
        other - the other CollisionGeometryOwner
        Returns:
        true if they can collide

      • canMoveCollideWith

        boolean canMoveCollideWith(CollisionGeometryOwner other)
        Get if this object can not move into another. This is used in the Entity-Method movePosition() return FALSE: This Entity can move over the other entity => SOFT COLLISION (Only notice) return TRUE : This Entity can not move over the other entity - they will collide. => HARD COLLISION (can't move into each other with movePosition() ) The results of this function should be commutative ( a.canCollideWith(b) == b.canCollideWith(a) ). If they are not canCollide(a, b) is calculated as a.canCollideWith(b) OR b.canCollideWith(a) EXCEPT when its a Entity<->Tile Collision, then the tile.canMoveCOllideWith() method is the one that counts
        Parameters:
        other - the tile to collide
        Returns:
        true if they can collide
